sentences.en: The fusty old establishment refused to recognise the demand for popular music.
sentences.cn: 这一古板的老旧机构拒绝承认人们对流行音乐的需求。

sentences.en: This blanket smells a bit fusty.
sentences.cn: 这毯子有点儿发霉的味儿.

sentences.en: Under Mr Blair, fusty old Britain has become an international exemplar of openness.
sentences.cn: 在布莱尔的领导下, 曾经老迈保守的大不列颠摇身一变成了国际间开放的榜样.

trans.tran_cn: 发霉的， 霉臭的，守旧的， 古板的
trans.tran_en: if rooms, clothes, buildings etc are fusty, they have an unpleasant smell, because they have not been used for a long time
